*"Time zero" or "time of presentation" is defined as the time of triage in the emergency department 
or, if presenting from another healthcare facility, from the earliest time-point in the treatment chart 
wherein, the patient had all the features consistent with sepsis. 
**Two or more sets of blood cultures are recommended before initiation of any new antimicrobial in 
all patients with suspected sepsis. 
***Hydroxyethyl starches (HESs) are not recommended for intravascular volume replacement in 
patients with sepsis or septic shock. 
**** Norepinephrine is the first-choice vasopressor.
